reviews.sentence: Fabulous short stay. Stopping overnight on the way home from Italy to Watford our expectations were for a value priced and comfortable place for our family of 4 to lay our heads but little more than that. So the complimentary upgrade to executive suites was very welcome. The facilities were excellent check in and out smooth and friendly and breakfast very good indeed. In addition the complimentary wifi was fast and easy to connect. In short an ideal stopover.

Reception good and friendly. Room good nice touch to have a bottle of water in the fridge. No shower cap in the shower. Hotel conveniently located for visiting city centre. We ate outside the hotel dinner and breakfastGeneraly speaking it conforms to the Novotel standard we expect.

Bar and conference areas are great. I did not stay in the Novotel but I used the bar and the upstairs conference rooms which were both very good. It is ideally located close to the train station and other amenities making it an ideal place for a business meeting. The lunchtime meal was nicely prepared and tasted great the dessert especially. Staff were friendly too.
Warm welcome at the reception very nice breakfasts convenient location 5 walk to the city center. The rooms start to get a little bit outdated for a 3 stars hotel.
Comfortable. Comfortable beds spacious rooms. Fridge in room. Decor could do with refreshing carpets stained. Not as fresh and modern as looked in photos reception area is lovely.
Thanks to Fanny in reception team made every thing nice to me my family with an one day upgrade made feel the real benefit of my membership plus he warm welcome and nice treatment.

Very basic and efficient. Family friendly. My son loved the pin ball game at the lobby. TV was very old small the display was disrupted repeatedly.

Good service polite and efficient. Good service friendly and polite at the reception bar and restaurant. The rooms and reception areas of the hotel are nice and clean. Staff are always welcoming and friendly. They take pride in the appearance of the hotel which is great to see. You have a well equipped bar and breakfast room. Food is good. Room size is perfect and well maintained.
Pleasant. Had problems with the lifts and the stairs were closed off.

Was good and hopefully will be again. I am an Acor Club Platinum member which means I have probably spent years in Acor hotels and I am glad to say that I have seldom needed to complain until earlier this week when I had the misfortune to spend three nights over the New Year period in a building site with a sign outside saying Novotel Anecy Centre Atria a Novotel I have stayed in a number of times in the past and was very much looking forward to a New Year break. Instead I needed to find the “ Temporary ” hotel entrance on the other side of the building from the car park entrance navigate my way through the office block corridors to the lifts to take me to the temporary reception. Although the reception staff themselves were very welcoming the hotel is in an extremely sorry state our “ Executive ” room was very tired with the furniture stained and grubby and the heating AC operated with a mind of its own I could not control it at all. My wife was very cold during our first night but by the middle of the night the heating had come on with no input from us and the room became too hot. When we checked into the room the alarm bells should have rung when I noticed that while the A C was switched on the temperature control had been set to 30 degrees and it was still cold. All of this was after negotiating three separate lifts to get from the car park to our room on the fourth floor. The hotel restaurant temporarily located in a soulless function room on the first night of our stay Dec 30th the food was very good but the service was pretty ropey. On the second night New Year ’s Eve both the food and the service were excellent but on our third night the food and service were both terrible. I think it is worth noting that the waiting staff on New Year ’s Eve was different to the other two nights much better and more efficient. In my considered opinion this hotel should close immediately not to reopen until the renovations have been completed or alternatively any on line enquiries or bookings should carry a highly visible warning that the hotel was undergoing major renovation resulting in considerable disruption to the service they can provide. A total of 693 € for three nights and three dinners for two in a building site is not good enough. In future I will be making very detailed checks on any Acor hotel I am thinking of making a reservation in.

Disappointing. Breakfast was ok. Rooms were way too hot 246C and air conditioning did nt work and windows would not open. We told the reception girl and she came up a couple of times but could nt open the window And said shed phone but then she did nt. My husband asked for a new room but they said there was nt one. She gave him a fan that did nt work. So none of us slept. The hotel was also a building site. We paid more than € 200 for 2 rooms. Extremely poor value for money.

Stuff did n’t work. Only one elevator and there was a problem with the keys. Reception is under staffed. An electricity problem caused us to have to change rooms. Shower water is not hot enough and the shower floor is slippery.

Disappointed. I made claim to reception and he told me that he will report to manager and email to me but no email I received so far. I do not like person who say I will do and never do it.

Wonderful. 1 one of the two elevators was out of order for the length of our stay 4nights. thi is unacceptable in modern times2 no ventilation in toilete3 there are no hangers or hooks in the bathroom to hang your clothes on or your towels.

Excellent. Very good location close to the main train station few minutes walking to the lake and old city reception staff were very cooperative and smily clean bathroom car parking was available and free. Elevators not so perfect and was out of use for a half day difficult climbing up to 5th floor by stair. Breakfast was very little quantity and not good for a 4 star hotel.

Great spot for short stopever in gorgeous Anecy. Easy booking staff were very helpful on checkin and checkout. Great breakfast buffet. Car park spaces are very tight. And the card reader in the lift did not always work to get access to the room floor.

Basic hotel in great location. Great location the hotel is just beside the train station very convenient and walking distance to the city centre. The hotel is above the train line but the rooms have great isolation and you can barely hear the trains. Rooms are big the bed is comfortable everything is very clean. Breakfast is good but could be improved. Hardly a 4 stars hotel as advertised on Booking. Hotel is very basic. There was only one person at the reception we had to wait half an hour to make the checkout as the only receptionist was assisting other guests with their fidelity card. Only when they heard me and my husband complaining they sent another person to check us out. Breakfast could be improved by changing some simple things such as the quality of the coffee it was almost undrinkable and changing the aromatised water every day the same lemon mint water was served 2 days in a row and the bitter taste on the second day could not hide that they had recycled it from the previous day.
